column4: For some reason when trying to update a program from a .deb, it says "Older version in software channel" and proceeds with the download, but the installed package is not the newer version :|
uninstall previous first and then install new?
That did not work.
When I did that, the "older" version was reinstalled.
what's the package for?
Free Pascal. "fpc" for apt-get, etc.
if i may ask, whats the version on a search for fpc*
What do you mean?
when you run an aptitude search for fpc*
It says installed version is 2.2.2 (which is what I want, the older one is 2.2.0), although when typing "fpc" on the terminal brings up version 2.2.0
what version runs? 2.2.0?
Yes, like I said :)
sorry im a little confused. to conclude, it says 2.2.2 is installed, which is what you want, but 2.2.0 comes up on the apt search?
and 2.2.2 is the one that runs?
No, no... In the synaptic window, it says the installed version is 2.2.2. But what actually runs is 2.2.0.
gimme a sec R0b0t1 ill brb, if someone else can help you during, tahts be grat
i know this may sound straight foward, but have tried a complete removal from synaptic package manager?
Yes.
well ill be
mind showing me where you acquired the 2.2.2 deb package?
actually im good, gimme a sec
http://sourceforge.net/project/downloading.php?group_id=2174&use_mirror=voxel&filename=fpc_2.2.2-0_all.deb&49860024
